poem:
Title: "City's Cry"

SUVs – their growl fills narrow lanes,
Paris, breathing croissant-scented disdain.
Joanna, Louis, crisscross streets,
Wish for less rubber, more cobblestone beats. 

Journeying infant in tow,
Voting in the streets' glow.
Dreams of a quieter roam,
Paris, make the city your own.

No more smoggy shroud,
Speak this wish aloud. 
For cities compact,
Demand the eco-contract.
